p: In the support of this traditional use, Zarali et al. studied the effects of adding the extract of Echinophora on the quality and sensory properties of buttermilk. The results showed that adding the extracts of E. platyloba in addition to improving the taste of the samples was useful in inhibiting the growth of mold and yeast in buttermilk samples. Thus, the extract of this plant can be used as the natural flavors of herbs and spices in buttermilk as a dairy drink.[ 20] Ehsani et al. studied the effects of adding the essential oil of E. platyloba on pasteurized creams and analyzed for microbial characteristics, sensorial properties, and lipid stability. Based on the results of study, application of E. platyloba essential oil as natural preservatives is especially recommended in high fat dairy products such as butter and cream.[ 21] Hasanvand et al. studied inhibitory effect of E. platyloba essential oil on Aspergillus flavus in cheese. Results indicated that essential oil of E. platyloba had antifungal activity and can be used as a mold inhibitor in foods such as cheese.[ 22]
